etymologies: Old English thē, accusative and dative case of thū ‘thou’

notes.text: The word thee is still used in some traditional dialects (e.g., in northern England) and among certain religious groups (e.g., Quakers), but in standard English it is restricted to archaic or religious contexts. For more details on thee and thou, see thou

crossReferenceMarkers: archaic or dialect form of you, as the singular object of a verb or preposition
